column4: startx results in no screens found. tried with ati card and onboard intel card. any thoughts
its not one of those new dual-gpu laptops?
it was working and then I added xorg-edgers ppa. and upgraded xserver from their source. then booting resulted in blank screen (no signal) after bootsplash
shall i ask why you did that if it was working?  ;)
removed xorg-edgers ppa, and got everything back to default. but its booting into tty1, and tty7 isn't running x.
upgraded graphics card from nvidia to ati. found a post that said xorg-edgers ati module was better than flgrx
yep, ppa-purge
wasn't an upgrade as much as I had the ati card laying around, and it would do what i needed it to
you could check the 'dkms' status command and purge and drivers from all kernels. and try reinstalling them
it pulled up nvidia and virtualbox-ose
thats a start. id remove those ;)
you mentioned purging the drivers from all kernels and reinstalling them.. what commands would do that?
gotcha, sorry wasn't thinking of drivers as packages..
I got it. Xorg.conf didn't exist in /etc/x11 so I copied a xorg.conf.backup to xorg.conf and Bingo! startx works again.
but now, the box still boots to tty1, and x still isn't automatically starting on tty7
the gdm service starts?
yup gdm starts
but i don't get the login screen. Instead I have to log in from tty1 and then startx opens my gnome desktop (because I'm already logged in)
be sure gdm is set to start at boot time
should be a /etc/init/gdm.conf
thanks for the help!
